name: PROXY METHODOLOGY [Malware Detected]
description: This rule looks for proxy traffic to a URL identified as malicious. This may not pose a risk if the traffic was blocked. If this rule triggers an alert, investigate the source to determine whether it allowed traffic to other malicious hosts around the same time frame.
tags: proxy,malware,Command and Control,Application Layer Protocol,T1071,Web Protocols,T1071.001,md-action
query: (class=checkpoint_http_proxy has:malwarefamily) OR (class=mcafee_web_gw (has:malwarename OR has:virus) NOT domain=notifications.google.com) OR (class:zscaler* has:malwaretype NOT malwaretype=[`submitted to sandbox`,`clean transaction`,`sandbox benign`,`none`]) OR (class=paloalto_threat_url info=`malware`) OR (class=trend_micro_http_proxy category=evt_virus_found) OR (class=cisco_ironport_http_proxy has:malwaretype) OR (class:fortinet_fortigate category:[`utm-webfilter`,`utm:webfilter`] description:[`malicious*`,`phishing`]) OR (class:iboss* category:[`malware`,`malware content`]) NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: PROXY METHODOLOGY [Malware Detected - Request Allowed]
description: This rule looks for allowed proxy traffic to a URL identified as containing malware. If this rule triggers an alert, investigate the source for signs of malware infection.
tags: proxy,malware,allow,Command and Control,Application Layer Protocol,T1071,Web Protocols,T1071.001,md-info
query: ((class=checkpoint_http_proxy has:malwarefamily action=[`allow`,`detect`,`monitor`]) OR (class:zscaler* has:malwaretype NOT malwaretype=[`submitted to sandbox`,`clean transaction`,`sandbox benign`,`none`] action=`allowed` risklevel>0) OR (class=cisco_ironport_http_proxy has:malwaretype NOT result=`tcp_denied` NOT malwaretype=`unknown`)) NOT statuscode=403 OR (class:fortinet_fortigate category:[`utm-webfilter`,`utm:webfilter`] description:[`malicious*`,`phishing`] action:`passthrough`) OR (class:iboss* category:[`malware`,`malware content`] action=`allowed`) NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: ZSCALER PROXY [Multiple Blocked Threats]
description: This rule looks for multiple Zscaler blocked threats from one source within a short period of time. This could indicate a potential compromise on the source host.
tags: zscaler,block,Command and Control,Application Layer Protocol,T1071,Web Protocols,T1071.001,md-info
query: class:zscaler* action=blocked has:threat NOT (threat=none OR threat:[`.pua.`]) NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4
